title: Drawing, Pair of Scissors with Handles Formed by Half-figures of Opposite Facing Lion-headed Sphinxes.
title_raw: Pair of Scissors with Handles Formed by Half-figures of Opposite Facing Lion-headed Sphinxes.
medium: Pen and  brown ink, brush and gray wash on heavy off-white paper
inscribed: Verso: Inscribed in graphite across sheet: P 12- / Leave paper / Middle row. / right; and again at lower left: Wf hand / Impero
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle showing a design for a pair of scissors with handles formed by half-figures of lion-headed sphinxes, facing in opposite directions.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Pair of Scissors with Handles Formed by Half-figures of Opposite Facing Lion-headed Sphinxes.. Pen and  brown ink, brush and gray wash on heavy off-white paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5451
